p: Monostroma nitidum ( M. nitidum) is a green alga that grows in shallow waters along the coasts of Japan. Rhamnan sulfate (RS) is another sulfated polysaccharide found in green seaweed [ 8], and it has recently been identified as a main component of M. nitidum [ 8, 9]. The main repeating unit of RS consists of rhamnose with a sulfate-group substituent that forms long linear chains with branched side chains [ 10, 11, 12]. Several in vitro and in vivo studies have reported that RS has anticoagulative [ 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17], antiviral [ 10, 18, 19, 20], anti-inflammatory [ 21], and anti-obesity properties [ 9].
